name: dependabot
description: Automatically update dependencies and vulnerabilities in your code using [Dependabot CLI](https://github.com/dependabot/cli)
author: Tingle Software

inputs.name: skipPullRequests
inputs.label: Skip creation and updating of pull requests.
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to `true` the logic to update the dependencies is executed but the actual Pull Requests are not created/updated. Defaults to `false`.

inputs.name: abandonUnwantedPullRequests
inputs.label: Abandon unwanted pull requests.
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to `true` pull requests that are no longer needed are closed at the tail end of the execution. Defaults to `false`.

inputs.name: commentPullRequests
inputs.label: Comment on abandoned pull requests with close reason.
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to `true` a comment will be added to abandoned pull requests explanating why it was closed. Defaults to `false`.

inputs.name: setAutoComplete
inputs.label: Auto-complete pull requests when all policies pass
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to `true`, pull requests that pass all policies will be merged automatically. Defaults to `false`.

inputs.name: mergeStrategy
inputs.label: Auto-complete merge Strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: The merge strategy to use. Learn more [here](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/git/pull-requests/update?view=azure-devops-rest-5.1&tabs=HTTP#gitpullrequestmergestrategy).

inputs.name: autoCompleteIgnoreConfigIds
inputs.label: Semicolon delimited list of any policy configuration IDs which auto-complete should not wait for.
inputs.helpMarkDown: A semicolon (`;`) delimited list of any policy configuration IDs which auto-complete should not wait for. Only applies to optional policies (isBlocking == false). Auto-complete always waits for required policies (isBlocking == true).

inputs.name: autoApprove
inputs.label: Auto-approve pull requests
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to `true`, pull requests will automatically be approved by the specified user. Defaults to `false`. Requires [Azure DevOps REST API 7.1](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/integrate/concepts/rest-api-versioning?view=azure-devops#supported-versions)

inputs.name: autoApproveUserToken
inputs.label: A personal access token of the user that should approve the PR.
inputs.helpMarkDown: A personal access token of the user of that shall be used to approve the created PR automatically. If the same user that creates the PR should approve, this can be left empty. This won't work with if the Build Service with the build service account!

inputs.name: authorEmail
inputs.label: Git commit uthor email address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The email address to use for the change commit author. Can be used to associate the committer with an existing account, to provide a profile picture. Defaults to `noreply@github.com`.

inputs.name: authorName
inputs.label: Git commit author name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name to use as the git commit author of the pull requests. Defaults to `dependabot[bot]`.

inputs.name: securityAdvisoriesFile
inputs.label: Path for the file containing security advisories in JSON format.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file containing security advisories.

inputs.name: azureDevOpsServiceConnection
inputs.label: Azure DevOps Service Connection to use.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a service connection to use, if you want to use a different service principal than the default to create your PRs.

inputs.name: azureDevOpsAccessToken
inputs.label: Azure DevOps Personal Access Token.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Personal Access Token for accessing Azure DevOps repositories. Supply a value here to avoid using permissions for the Build Service either because you cannot change its permissions or because you prefer that the Pull Requests be done by a different user. Use this in place of `azureDevOpsServiceConnection` such as when it is not possible to create a service connection.

inputs.name: gitHubConnection
inputs.label: GitHub connection (OAuth or PAT)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the GitHub service connection to use to connect to the GitHub repositories. The connection must be based on a GitHub user's OAuth or a GitHub personal access token. Learn more about service connections [here](https://aka.ms/AA3am5s).

inputs.name: gitHubAccessToken
inputs.label: GitHub Personal Access Token.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The raw Personal Access Token for accessing GitHub repositories. Use this in place of `gitHubConnection` such as when it is not possible to create a service connection.

inputs.name: storeDependencyList
inputs.label: Monitor the discovered dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Determines if the last know dependency list information should be stored in the parent DevOps project properties. If enabled, the authenticated user must have the `Project & Team (Write)` permission for the project. Enabling this option improves performance when doing security-only updates. Defaults to `false`.

inputs.name: targetRepositoryName
inputs.label: Target Repository Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the repository to target for processing. If this value is not supplied then the Build Repository Name is used. Supplying this value allows creation of a single pipeline that runs Dependabot against multiple repositories.

inputs.name: targetUpdateIds
inputs.label: Semicolon delimited list of update identifiers to run.
inputs.helpMarkDown: A semicolon (`;`) delimited list of update identifiers run. Index are zero-based and in the order written in the configuration file. When not present, all the updates are run. This is meant to be used in scenarios where you want to run updates a different times from the same configuration file given you cannot schedule them independently in the pipeline.

inputs.name: dependabotCliImage
inputs.label: Dependabot CLI image
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override the Dependabot CLI go module location and/or version. When specified, this takes presidence over any pre-installed version of Dependabot on the agent. Defaults to `github.com/dependabot/cli/cmd/dependabot@latest`.

inputs.name: dependabotUpdaterImage
inputs.label: Dependabot updater image
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override the Dependabot updater image location and/or version. When specified, use `{package-ecosystem}` as a subsistute for the package ecosystem (if required). Defaults to `ghcr.io/dependabot/dependabot-updater-{package-ecosystem}:latest`.

inputs.name: experiments
inputs.label: Dependabot updater experiments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-seperated list of key/value pairs representing the enabled Dependabot experiments e.g. `experiments: 'tidy=true,vendor=true,goprivate=*'`. Available options vary depending on the package ecosystem. See [configuring experiments](https://github.com/tinglesoftware/dependabot-azure-devops/#configuring-experiments) for more details.
